summary: "Wish You Were Here" is Pink Floyd's ninth album, released in 1975. It's about feeling alone and criticizes the music industry. The band wrote it while touring Europe and recorded it in London. The album is mostly a tribute to their former member, Syd Barrett, who left due to mental health issues. They used cool studio effects and had guest singers. It became very popular and was ranked one of the greatest albums ever, even though some critics didn't like it at first.
title: Wish You Were Here (Pink Floyd album)
